comments:
I'm using I20050622 build.
To repro:
1.  Create a new Generic WebLogic 9.0 server runtime (I have a version of 9.0 on
my machine) (Note, I used the 'Default JRE' which for me is 1.5.0_01)
2.  In servers window, right click and select New
3.  Create a new Generic WebLogic 9.0 server
4.  Press the little green arrow to start the server

NOTE:  if in step 1 I actually select jre1.5.0_01 instead of using 'default'
this bug doesn't repro even though the default is the same as jre1.5.0_01
Results:
An error appears stating that an internal error occurred trying to start the
server.  In the log file is the following:
!ENTRY org.eclipse.core.runtime 4 2 2005-06-22 14:57:31.653
!MESSAGE An internal error occurred during: "Starting server".
!STACK 0
java.lang.NullPointerException
	at
org.eclipse.jst.server.generic.core.internal.GenericServerBehaviour.setupLaunch(GenericServerBehaviour.java:376)
	at
org.eclipse.jst.server.generic.core.internal.ExternalLaunchConfigurationDelegate.launch(ExternalLaunchConfigurationDelegate.java:99)
	at
org.eclipse.debug.internal.core.LaunchConfiguration.launch(LaunchConfiguration.java:590)
	at
org.eclipse.debug.internal.core.LaunchConfiguration.launch(LaunchConfiguration.java:515)
	at
org.eclipse.debug.internal.core.LaunchConfiguration.launch(LaunchConfiguration.java:152)
	at org.eclipse.wst.server.core.internal.Server.start(Server.java:959)
	at org.eclipse.wst.server.core.internal.Server.synchronousStart(Server.java:1275)
	at org.eclipse.wst.server.ui.internal.StartServerJob.run(StartServerJob.java:43)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:76)

Looks like some of the generic server code has changed since the last time I
tested things w/ WLS 9.0 - I'll look into things now...

hmmm, I'm unable reproduce it using the latest from HEAD (I've tried it using
the default JRE, both 1.4.2 and 1.5.0, as an explicitly assigned JRE)

Gorkem: looks like the NPE is being generated on the call to retrieve the
ServerPorts (which is odd) - also odd that this is tied to the selection of the
JRE for the server runtime (could an error processing the JRE for the runtime
for some reason cause problem in serverdef file processing?)

You know, as I try again, it isn't tied to JRE selection.  It just repros either
way.  Sorry about that.

FYI: I tried a few other permutations but have been unable to reproduce this bug:
-used just the 6/22 I-build (and dependent components) and that I-build plus the
generic server plugins built from the latest CVS source (note: there are a few
diffs between the I-build and the latest in CVS).
-launched the test Eclipse instance with various JREs: 1.5 (Sun and JRockit) and
1.4.2

I do not have a WLS 9 but I could not repro with wls8.1 also. Is your eclipse
running on a JRE 1.5? Also can you enable trace as Rob described?

Probably unrelated, but here's another thought about what might be causing this:
I believe the version of EMF used with the WTP I-builds changed recently (now
emf-sdo-xsd-SDK-I200506160200.zip) and perhaps if you still had the old version
that could cause in an error processing the serverdef XML file since the generic
server framework uses EMF to perform XML data binding on these files.

OK, I did some more research and I had an old version of Java 1.5 JRE (like b08
instead of b64).  So I updated that to the latest, and guess what.  Things seem
to work.  At least I don't get that NPE I was seeing before.

Not sure if it makes sense that an older version of Java1.5 would cause this
crash, but it appears that it was.

Thanks,
Jill
After upgrading JDK, no longer having this issue.  Thanks.
